revised_title: Relativistic Theory of Non-Radial Stellar Oscillations and Gravitational Waves
tldr: The authors apply the relativistic theory of non-radial stellar oscillations to non-barotropic stars and find that it reproduces the results of the Newtonian theory. They also show that the information about different types of oscillation modes is coded in the gravitational field, which can be found by scattering gravitational waves. However, the theory faces limitations in determining the damping time associated with the emission of gravitational waves.
